data.description:
Whirligig is a VR media player for the playback and viewing of video and images. It support a wide range of projection types, video support and visual options to make watching your media as enjoyable as possible. 

Main Features
A wide range of projection types including fisheye 90 to 360 degrees, equirectangular, cinema, and custom formats for more unusual projection types including  cubemaps, camera specific projection and many more. All viewable in stereo over under and side by side.
3 render paths to choose from to offer the widest possible video support.
A selection of backgrounds to choose.
Give your media an outer glow.
Subtitle support with accompanying srt files or internal using the Video Lan video path.
16 Save/Load slots to save your position in files and bookmark them for later.
Save media settings into presets to easily switch between projection types.
Bookmark your media so you can easily return to them later.

changelog.change_log:
Quest 1 update.

The Quest 1 development is much harder since Meta changed their SDK's for Unity and dropped support for the original Quest. This is a real shame as the original Quest is still a very good headset and works well with movie playback.

I've worked hard to get this updated to work with the latest build. The Quest 1 version won't be updated as often as the Quest 2/3 and doesn't have passthrough support.

If you have issues please let me know phileday@yahoo.co.uk

I hope you enjoy the update.

All the best

Phil
Whirligig is a media player and requires access to the internal storage so people can access their media files.
